chaise noun [C]
(VEHICLE)
a carriage (= a road vehicle pulled by horses that was used in the past) for two people: She stepped down from the chaise and looked around her. He helped her into a chaise and four (= pulled by four horses) that was waiting outside the house.
More examplesFewer examplesIf the weather is poor, they will come in their chaise.The chaise came for us early the next morning and we were at home by nine.He travelled the last mile on foot, having dismissed the chaise and driver.
